result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nickolas Devon Beckom

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nickolas Devon Beckom not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Nickolas Devon Beckom.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
OFF THE RECORD:  Court waives defendant's appearance for today's court date.  Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/30/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Defendant Nickolas Devon Beckom in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Nickolas Devon Beckom.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  State advises Court that a DPA resolution was offered and will revoke offer at final pretrial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nickolas Devon Beckom in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date to determine satus of case.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nickolas Devon Beckom in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court orders defendant to re-interview with SPD. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with QNC; address listed in criminal complaint
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Nickolas Devon Beckom in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Nickolas Devon Beckom in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nickolas Devon Beckom appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
